creator: shanwill44@yahoo.com
text:
Actually on httpd 2.0.53 (no bug report page at present)
and Solaris 9 (Intel), we configured

		./configure --enable-module=so \
                --enable-dav=yes \
                --enable-ssl --with-ssl=/usr/local/ssl

and, at  make, we obtained

/hoge/httpd-2.0.53/support/ab.c:914: undefined refer
ence to `sqrt'

rt'

rt'

Sorry. It was an insufficient editing,

text:
After running configure, what is the output of 'srclib/apr/apr-config --libs'?

For sqrt(), it should have -lm listed in there.

On my Solaris 9/Intel box, it reports:

% ./apr-config --libs
 -lsendfile -lrt -lm -lsocket -lnsl -lresolv  -lpthread -ldl
creator: jerenkrantz@apache.org

text:
In your configure output, what does the 'checking for library containing sqrt' line say?

On my Solaris box, it says:

...
checking for library containing sqrt... -lm
...

What compiler and kernel revision (uname -a) are you using?
creator: jerenkrantz@apache.org

text:
checking for library containing sqrt... no

% uname -a
SunOS astro 5.9 Generic_112234-07 i86pc i386 i86pc

Thanks in advance.
creator: shanwill44@yahoo.com
jerenkrantz@apache.org
text:
Your system is wildly out-of-date.  You should apply the latest patches from
Sun, available at:

http://sunsolve.sun.com/pub-cgi/show.pl?target=patches/patch-access

You are probably suffering from a library bug that has been fixed in current
patch clusters of Solaris 9.

(The current kernel version for Solaris 9/Intel is 117172-17.)
Out of date solaris install -> Invalid.
creator: chip@force-elite.com
